poem:
"In the Frequency of Shared Tales"

Sounds scribed in the ether, the air hums, tells of
Gatekeepers, Lover of the Million Dollar kind,
And hearts that weave Radical Empathy, unfathomable.
A Devil dances in the shadows of our shared nether,
While Humphries, Gloriously Uncut, echoes in time.
Hmm. The internet state, sung in frequencies fine,
In the subtle lullaby of BBC's 'Series Nine'.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Hmm. Having". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
